Description: Fragment of handle-plate of Attic black-figured pottery column-krater; interior: top of neck glazed black; on top: dilute line on inner edge of rim; black-figure decoration consisting of female head to right (top and back remaining; hair, ear, part of eyebrow, wide fillet with added red blobs and red dot on ear lobe).
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0124) (Phase 1)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 204, no. B13)
